title: What the fuck happened to Mundo?
body:

I really don't understand how people keep defending Riot's decisions. Look at the last buff they gave to Trundle, it's like they're just completely out of touch with their own roster, like there's no thought that goes into what they're doing. 

They nerfed the hell out of Pillar, his bread n' butter skill for teamfighting, skirmishing, nearly everything (it's near useless at early ranks, and by the time it becomes useful most games are already decided). Then they nerfed his base damage and changed his scaling on Chomp so it's weaker early and scales a bit better IF he builds a decent amount of damage. The problem with this is that he scales primarily with health and CDR, and damage-wise scales about as well as most support tank champions. In addition, if he wants to actually not be dead weight he maxes W last, which makes the latest buff pretty much pointless. 

Nobody picks Trundle for his damage, so no matter how much they buff his damage he's never going to be picked over champions that have real damage scaling, as well as more consistent ways of dealing damage. I mean damn, I'm no expert on balancing, but logic would denote that if hitting his Pillar with nerfs is what made him disappear, maybe that's what should be changed. Maybe the nerfs were too harsh. But no, it's like they completely lack any semblance of common sense when they make changes. 

It just gets so tiring. I really wish they would hire some people that would view this game's balance in a more objective and fair way.

don't forget that trundle is pretty much a bruiser/juggernaut, so his main value is his ability to deal lots of damage and be durable

His main value is in his objective control and self-sufficiency, along with his unique utility. When his skills become weak, he simply doesn't get picked, much less building an expensive item like Trinity Force. In my arrogant opinion he doesn't scale well enough as a damage source to justify a lofty purchase like that, especially one with no real defensive stats. The CDR is the most attractive thing about the item, but there are better choices for that. 

For example {{item:3800}} is literally amazing if you need health, sustain, CDR and want to actually catch targets. I wouldn't be surprised if Riot nerfs it at some point. This is probably one of the best items in the game right now for champions that scale with health and have limited tools for sticking to targets.

If you want attack speed/on hit {{item:3153}} is exponentially better than Trinity on him. However, because Vayne is abusing it it's getting a price increase of 100g, fantastic. I mean, they could just nerf Vayne but god forbid she doesn't get picked every other game. Neeko occasionally builds this as well, but clearly her invalidating melees in lane isn't the problem, it's the item.

I've noticed some real laziness on Riot explaining what they are doing in regards to balance so far this season. Patch notes are one sentence "Yeah we're buffing this guy." and the context is usually very lacking. There also seems to be less involvement on the boards as well whereas they used to explain what they were doing in the past.

I don't know if Riot has just said "Fuck it, we're making money, we don't need to explain ourselves" at this point but they feel more disconnected from their community than I've seen in the last five years.
